documents.title: man dies in car crash on canvey
text: essex police say a 69-year old man has died after his car crashed into a wooden fence on canvey island .
his orange daewoo matiz went off central wall road at about 14:30 on thursday .
the man was taken to basildon hospital , but could n't be saved .
police said no other vehicles were involved , but they 're appealing for witnesses on 01245 240590 .

documents.title: nhs attack 'could have been prevented ' , says security expert
text: dr mils hills , who is an associate professor of risk , resilience and corporate security at the university of northampton , has told the bbc the cyber attack on the nhs `` could have been prevented '' .
`` it 's most certainly going to have come from a user clicking something they should n't have , whether it 's in an email or on an internet browser tab , '' he said .
`` hospitals should have measures to prevent this .
`` it will be fixed and removed , but it will cost a lot .
the task to fix it wo n't be difficult , but will be time-consuming .
`` the problem is this is a pretty low-level attack and it 's causing such chaos . ''

an nhs digital statement said : `` nhs digital is working closely with the national cyber security centre , the department of health and nhs england to support affected organisations and ensure patient safety is protected . ''
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

text: most of this afternoon 's showers should quickly move away to leave a largely dry and frost-free night with clear spells across the bbc east region .
temperatures in some spots will remain in double figures .
it 's spells of sunshine and scattered showers for saturday , and while we ca n't rule out an odd heavy downpour , there will be some places that stay dry throughout the day .

documents.title: nhs cyber attacks affecting essex hospitals
text: nhs hospitals across the uk have been hit by cyber attacks affecting their it systems .
among those affected elsewhere are the lister hospital in stevenage and hospitals in blackburn , blackpool , nottingham and carlisle .
in essex , colchester general and broomfield in chelmsford has confirmed they are affected .
southend said it was not directly affected , while other hospitals were still checking .

documents.title: colchester a & e advises patients to only arrive for emergencies
text: colchester general hospital in essex is asking patients not to come to its accident and emergency department and is postponing all non-urgent procedures for the rest of the day .
it 's due to the cyber-attack on nhs it systems across the uk .
colchester is still open for 999 emergencies .

documents.title: from the archives : new domes market unveiled at pitsea 1969
text: some 48 years ago this month , the new futuristic market at pitsea , near basildon - which comprises of four plastic-covered domes made of steel-pipe , each dome housing 52 stalls - was photographed .
the temporary new market place was constructed , with domes built in sweden , when a flyover took the place of the old one .
the domes were taken down towards the end of the 1970s after the market moved to a new site .

documents.title: house destroyed by fire in downham
text: a house has been destroyed by a fire in the village of downham near chelmsford .
crews were called to school road just after 11:00 .
an investigation 's started to try and work out what caused it .
there are no reports of any injuries .

documents.title: fatal crash in st osyth
text: here is a of the crash in st osyth yesterday afternoon , which killed a man who was on the pavement outside the hoy pub .
floral tributes to the victim , who was in his 70s and has been named locally as ron ramsey , have been left outside the pub today .
a 36-year-old woman was taken to hospital with what essex police called `` serious , but not life-changing , injuries '' .
she was arrested on sus of causing death by dangerous driving and is in police custody .

documents.title: forklift truck raiders rip out cash machine in manningtree
text: raiders have ripped a cash machine out of a bank in manningtree using a forklift truck .
officers are investigating the theft at natwest , at the junction of high street and brook street , which happened at about 02:10 today .
a number of suspects wearing balaclavas were reported to have been seen to use a forklift truck to create a hole in the wall .
the cash machine was then pulled from the building .
police chased three vehicles , which were seen travelling along clacton road into dead lane , lawford .
these vehicles - a toyota truck , a blue audi and a black ford fiesta - were believed to be driven by the suspects .
following this pursuit the toyota truck and fiesta were recovered , however the suspects made off in the blue audi .
an audi was later discovered in wyncolls road , colchester and had been set alight .
the forklift was found in school lane , lawford , while the cash machine was found near to the toyota , which had been abandoned .
witnesses reported descriptions of two suspects , however due to the number of vehicles involved in the pursuit , it is believed there were more .
one man was described as white , and was wearing a plain hoodie and jeans .
the other man was described as stocky , and was wearing grey tracksuit bottoms .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

text: man denies murdering bulgarian teenager

documents.title: symptoms 'not up ' at harlow hospital
text: we 've been reporting the story of the essex teenager who was left with irreversible brain damage caused by negligence at harlow 's princess alexandra hospital when she was 13 months old
the girl 's frantic mother told the civil appeal court in london that her daughter 's eyes were rolling as she was rushed to hospital by ambulance in september 2003 .

but , after she arrived in a & e , the doctor failed to ask an `` obvious question '' - why the child had been brought to hospital in the early hours of the morning - and so did not learn of the symptoms of the eyes rolling .
the girl 's damages claim was rejected by a judge in 2015 , but the court of appeal today reversed that decision and ruled the trust liable .

lady justice thirlwall , sitting with lord justice jackson and mrs justice king , said : `` the conclusion that the history-taking was not carried out to the standard to be expected of a competent senior house officer is inevitable . ''
lord justice jackson said : `` history-taking is a basic skill which hospital doctors at all levels are expected to possess .
`` the fact that the girl 's eyes had been rolling and unco-ordinated was the event that precipitated the hospital visit .
the ambulance staff this up . ''
`` i must acknowledge that junior hospital doctors work long hours under considerable pressure .
`` they are often involved in life and death decisions. ``
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: essex teenager wins damages from harlow hospital
text: an essex teenager , who was left with irreversible brain damage after battling meningitis , has won the right to multi-million-pound compensation from the nhs .
the high court judges ruled that the 14-year-old 's injuries were caused by the negligence of a hard-pressed young doctor at harlow 's princess alexandra hospital .
the 25-year-old medic had failed to take a proper medical history before discharging the girl home with a suspected upper respiratory tract infection .
the girl , who was a 13-month-old baby at the time , was left with learning difficulties and profoundly deaf , london 's civil appeal court heard .
today 's ruling means she is entitled to massive compensation from the nhs trust which runs the hospital .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: museum open to bring essex aerodrome back to 'former glory '
text: we reported earlier how the 100th anniversary of the first recorded british ambulance flight , during world war one , has been celebrated at stow maries great war aerodrome , near chelmsford .
the event , which included a recreation of the rescue ( also saw the opening of a museum at the site yesterday .

ian flint , chief executive of the trust which runs the airfield , said : `` we want to bring the site back to its former glory and bring the stories of these incredible people and their bravery back into the public mindset 100 years after their work finished . ''
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: x-ray machine failure at airport was an 'isolated incident '
text: bosses at stansted airport say a major x-ray machine failure earlier this week was an `` isolated incident '' .
long delays were seen at the north essex terminal and a number of people missed their flights .
a technical glitch is being blamed .

documents.title: world war one rescue celebrated at essex airfield
text: a world war one fighter plane has taken part in a simulated air evacuation to mark the 100th anniversary of the first recorded british ambulance flight .

the be2 twin-seater plane ( used in a demonstration to open a new ww1 museum at stow maries aerodrome , near chelmsford , was the same model of bi-plane that was used in 1917 to lift a soldier to safety from the sinai desert in egypt after he was shot in the ankle during a raid .
the sinai evacuation took 45 minutes by plane , and would have taken three days by camel .
aeromedical services were started up in various parts of the world in the 1920s , but aircraft were still relatively primitive at the time .
it formed part of the official opening of a second museum at the site , which is europe 's largest surviving ww1 aerodrome , and is located near purleigh , around 10 miles east of chelmsford .
stow maries was established to help protect britain from german zeppelin bombing and its first operational anti-zeppelin flight was in may 1917 .
fighter planes were used to guard the approaches to london and chelmsford .
the royal flying corps home defence museum opened at the aerodrome last year , and a museum to 37 squadron was officially opened by the duke of gloucester yesterday .
the museum at stow maries will open six days per week , and work is under way to develop an engineering education programme .
a hercules transport plane ( flew overhead to mark the occasion .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: travellers have moved on says brentwood council
text: brentwood borough council says a group of travellers - who were camped on land at the former toomey peugeot garage on ingrave road - have now moved on after legal action was taken against them .
however , the authority says caravans remain at two privately-owned sites in the area .

documents.title: food writer jack monroe abandons bid for election
text: food writer jack monroe has abandoned her bid to win a seat in the house of commons after receiving hate mail and suffering a deterioration in her health .
ms monroe , who is also a campaigner on health and poverty issues , said she was taking the decision `` for my own sanity and also the safety of my seven-year-old son '' .
she had planned to contest the southend west seat for the national health action ( nha ) party .
in a statement on her twitter feed monroe said : `` i have withdrawn my candidacy from the general election .

`` my health is terrible right now ( do n't be fooled by the glowing tan - it 's from a bottle ) and after having two separate letters along the lines of 'die you bitch ' delivered to my home address , i am making the decision to step back , for my own sanity and also the safety of my seven-year-old son . ''
she said she had been left `` crippled in bed '' by arthritis and `` throwing all of my energy into a personal campaign is the fastest way to burnout i can possibly imagine '' .

documents.title: ferne mccann : towie star breaks down on this morning
text: towie star ferne mccann has appeared on this morning after her ex-boyfriend arthur collins was charged following an acid attack at a london nightclub .
ms mccann , who is 12 weeks pregnant , broke down as she told presenters phillip schofield and holly willoughby : `` reading through the private messages on instagram has been so touching '' .

documents.title: two defenders released by colchester united
text: the colchester united football club head coach john mcgreal says injuries played a key in the decision to release both matt briggs ( in blue ) and lloyd doyley .
the two defenders are the only senior first team players to be allowed to leave the club .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: consultation over essex police and fire service collaboration
text: more than 1,700 people have responded to the consultation into the local case for joint governance of essex police and essex county fire and rescue service .
the office of the police and crime commissioner is looking at further collaboration between the services , the sharing of premises and back office functions such it and hr .
the pcc said projected savings of up to £ 23m will be reinvested back in to front line services over the next 10 years .

pcc roger hirst , who has been consulting over the plans , said : `` my office and i have spent the past 12 weeks engaging with police and fire and rescue staff , talking to the people of essex and engaging with essex county , southend-on-sea borough and thurrock councils .
`` further support has been given by essex mps and positive conversations have been had with staff unions and associations .
`` i will be submitting the final business case to the home office on the 18 may along with a thorough evaluation of the public consultation .
`` i 'd like to thank everyone for taking the time to submit their views . ''
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: ukip launches fisheries policy
text: the uk independence party has launched its fisheries policy , promising fishermen along the east coast that they will `` always have a friend in ukip '' .
the party wants the uk to have full control of fishing within its territorial waters once we 've left the eu .
its fisheries spokesman mike hookem mep said he was worried that the conservatives would sacrifice fishing rights as part of the wider brexit negotiations .
`` despite some conservatives talking tough , no action has been taken to convince me that they have any intention of supporting the industry or reclaiming our waters , '' he said .
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

documents.title: vandals cause £ 80,000 of damage at car dealership
text: earlier we told you about a car dealer who says he 's devastated after vehicles on his forecourt in rochford were trashed by vandals .
police are investigating - two youngsters have been arrested and released under investigation .
shane gordon , who has only just moved to the site and was uninsured , said he 's now been left with a bill of £ 80,000 .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: brentwood reality tv star 's tears over pregnancy
text: brentwood 's own reality television star ferne mccann broke down in tears as she said how `` stressful and surreal '' her pregnancy has been .
the father of her unborn child has recently appeared in court charged in connection with an acid attack at an east london nightclub .

mccann 's former boyfriend arthur collins is charged with 14 counts of grievous bodily harm ( gbh ) with intent against four men and 10 women , and one count of throwing an acidic liquid with intent to do gbh to multiple people .
the incident on easter monday left two revellers partially blinded and others disfigured .
in her first interview since mr collins ' arrest , mccann told itv 's this morning : `` 'this is n't how i expected my first pregnancy to be , but it 's not about what happened .
it is about this baby . ''

mccann , best-known for her appearances on the only way is essex and i 'm a celebrity get me out of here ! , started to cry and added : `` i 'm going to be strong , i 'm going to try and keep it together i really do n't want to cry .
my main concern and priority is the baby . ''
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: deaf woman 's 'upsetting ' experience at hands of taxi driver
text: a deaf woman whose hearing dog was refused entry to a taxi has spoken to bbc essex about the `` extremely upsetting '' experience .
sophie biebuyck ( of brentwood , essex , was on her way to a wedding reception in london with her hearing dog rusty when the driver refused to take her dog without the extra charge .
sophie refused and arrived late to the reception .
the taxi driver was successfully prosecuted for his actions .
sophie said : `` the taxi driver refused to take rusty and so i spent some time explaining the law to him .
`` when he saw me taking photographs he said he would take the dog if i paid an extra £ 45 .
i said that was also illegal .
`` being denied access to the minicab on the day of my friend 's wedding was extremely upsetting and embarrassing .
`` my hearing dog rusty is not just a loyal companion ; he 's my ears , alerting me to important sounds and sirens .
`` without rusty by my side i would not be as independent as i am today . ''
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: plans for new £ 11m technical skills college at stansted airport
text: stansted airport and harlow college have submitted plans for a new £ 11m technical skills college on the airport site .
they say it will be the first campus of its kind in the country .
managers are hoping to start work , near to the long-stay car park , later this year with the facility opening in the autumn of 2018 .

karen spencer , harlow college principal and chief executive , said : `` we firmly believe that genuine partnerships between employers and education can help young people make informed choices about their future .

`` by working alongside stansted 's business partners we can provide young people and adults with the right skills to give them great careers , whether it be in aviation , engineering , hospitality or business . ''

david finch , leader of essex county council , said : `` we 're dedicated to tackling the skills shortage in essex to ensure that businesses have access to the right people , and residents are properly equipped to take advantage of the opportunities our growing economy will bring . ''
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

a walkabout in # aveley for # brexit secretary david davis as he meets jackie doyle-price and stephen metcalfe # thurrock # ge2017

BBC Essex political reporter

documents.title: concern over plans to close level crossings in essex
text: a council has raised concerns over network rail plans to close or change the use of 57 level crossings in essex .
next tuesday , a full meeting of essex county council is being asked to put forward objections to the plans .
a report to the council says the plans would divert a number of public footpaths `` requiring people to walk in the carriageway or on a verge which is unsuitable to be used for walkers '' .
the council is particularly concerned about footpath plans at crossing in benfleet , rettendon , alresford , wrabness , wakes colne , mount bures and ardleigh .
network rail says its plans will reduce the level of maintenance of the level crossings , improve the safety of crossings and will `` deliver a more efficient and reliable railway '' .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: boat owners urged to 'be alarmed '
text: it 's believed alan frost and tina wilkins had left their main engine running , and fumes from the exhaust had worked their way into the canopy and accommodation areas .
gas accumulated , as all ventilation was shut .
with no carbon monoxide alarm on board , the couple were not alerted to the presence of the gas .
carbon monoxide is ever-present on small boats , with combustion engines and gas cookers .
but the fitting of alarms on boats is not a legal requirement .
the marine accident invesigation branch ( maib ) report into the deaths of the essex couple on wroxham broad in june last year , mentions some recommendations it made in 2015 to improve safety .
maib spokesman tony brown says a law would help , but ultimately it 's the responsibility of individual boat owners to ensure the safety of their own boats and the people on them .

`` in the leisure boating area , there 's lots of boats in close proximity and all with confined spaces inside the presence of carbon monoxide is quite common , particularly with engine start-ups , '' he warned .

boats , like caravans and dwellings , are enclosed spaces keep watchful and be aware of the dangers carbon monoxide is a silent killer , no odour , you ca n't taste it , the symptoms are largely unrecognised . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: brexit secretary david davis in essex today
text: essex understands that the brexit secretary david davis will be campaigning for the conservatives in the county today .
he will be joining jackie doyle-price in the marginal seat of thurrock .
thurrock was once a safe labour seat but in this election the tories are privately confident they will turn a slim 500 majority to one deep into the thousands for jackie doyle-price .
labour hopes the appeal of high profile former council leader john kent will outperform current opinion polls .
ukip says its party is still popular in thurrock , which two years ago was a close three-way split between the conservatives , labour and ukip .
author: Simon Dedman
BBC Essex political reporter

documents.title: car dealer in rochford devastated by vandalism
text: i 've been to interview a car dealer who says he 's devastated after vehicles on his forecourt in rochford have been completely trashed by vandals .
police are investigating - two youngsters have been arrested and released under investigation .
shane gordon , who has only just moved to the site and was uninsured , said he 's now been left with a bill running into the tens of thousands of pounds .
`` i have been working seven days a week since i was 17 .
things were just starting to pay off .
it 's just absolutely broken me , '' he said .
we 'll bring you some video of the damage soon .
author: Stuart Woodward
BBC Essex

documents.title: wroxham boat deaths : couple 's first boat holiday
text: retired carpenter alan frost had bought the love for lydia in march 2016 .
he 'd previously hired boats on the broads with his long-term partner , tina wilkins , 51 .
it was the first boat the couple had owned , and neither of them held any boating qualifications .
the couple had collected the boat from its moorings at sabena marine on 6 june .
it would be their first holiday on board .

on the afternoon of 9 june , an ice cream vendor had become concerned after noticing the love for lydia had been moored alongside wroxham island for two days - the maximum permitting mooring time is 24 hours .
he , and another boater , discovered the bodies of mr frost and ms wilkins inside the boat , and alerted emergency services .
police officers were taken to the island on the river bure in the ice cream vendor 's boat , with other emergency services being transported by broads authority rangers .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police write to sugar hut clubbers
text: essex police has written to everyone who was at the sugar hut nightclub in brentwood , on the night that a car mounted the pavement outside hitting three people .
officers are treating the incident last month as attempted murder .
all three victims are now recovering at home .
three people have been arrested and bailed in connection with the incident .
author: Sonia Watson
BBC Essex

documents.title: report into wroxham boat deaths
text: a report has been released into the deaths of two people and their dog on a boat on the norfolk broads .
alan frost , 64 , and 51-year-old tina wilkins , and their dog died on board their boat , `` love for lydia '' , on wroxham broad in june last year .
it 's believed the couple , from grays , essex , had left the motor idling when they 'd moored up to charge the batteries on board .
there were no carbon monoxide alarms on the boat .
the marine accident investigation branch ( maib ) report concludes engine emissions got into the cabin , becoming concentrated within eight minutes .
some leisure boaters do not realise the importance of fitting an alarm , and the maib says awareness still needs raising .
author: Caroline Kingdon

documents.title: intruder defecates in electoral services room in clacton town hall
text: an intruder defecated in the electoral services room of clacton town hall in the early hours of this morning , the bbc understands .
essex police says someone broke into the council building through a window at about 01:00 , but the suspect is thought to have left without taking anything .
human excrement is understood to have been discovered on the floor .
tendring district council confirmed the break-in and said the incident was caught on cctv .
the council appealed for witnesses to contact the police .

documents.title: parents will get refunds for space kingdom bookings after temporary closure
text: the director of an indoor play centre in clacton says refunds will be offered to parents who have booked children 's parties after it was forced to close down .
space kingdom has shut its doors for a two-week period .
it 's hoping to re-open in the future .
in statement , caroline hunt said space kingdom 's owner had recently passed away .
`` the decision to close space kingdom is for two weeks at present , `` she said .
`` all parties have been contacted and reimbursed - all monies for deposits paid .
`` space kingdom has been a wonderful , clean , fun play centre for local children and has worked with nurseries and schools to provide a great place for families to enjoy . ''
clacton 's @ twitterid tells bbc essex its offering refunds after shutting temporarily .
it hopes to reopen .
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: brentwood 's general election candidates have their say on the traveller issue
text: essex challenged each of brentwood 's prospective mps to say how they would deal with the influx of travellers in the town , after three separate camps were identified locally .
here 's what they said :
michael mcgough , ukip
`` i would do what they 've done in the republic of ireland , which is to force most of them to come over here .
i 'm campaigning to ensure a complete brexit and controls over immigration . ''
paul jeater , green

`` i 'd ensure that court orders were issued promptly , that a clean-up was prompt and where examples of fly-tipping were seen , prompt action was taken there - and that those guilty of fly-tipping were prosecuted . ''
alex burghart , conservative

`` i would look into bringing in laws on intentional trespass which would make it much easier for the police to get people off private land.i 'm standing for theresa may to provide safe and secure government this country needs as we go forward with brexit . ''
karen chilvers , liberal democrat
i 'm looking to establish a fair society and tolerant society - that includes making the 12 or so legal pitches finally published so we can treat everyone fairly in this society . ''
gareth barrett , labour
`` i would make sure the local authorities and the police had the funding they need , especially reverse the 800 police officers cut in essex .
more widely the major issue in this election is the nhs and the social care crisis thht we have to get over now . ''
luke kousoulou , independent

`` if the travellers are on private land without permission , the council should find land they can stay on until we know what they want as we have to respect their way of life , but we must also respect the community and understand the law does not stand in their favour , and they must respect and agree to what compromise we can find to sort this situation . ''
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: county 's neighbourhood watch to get more than 10k to bring communities closer
text: neighbourhood watch teams in essex are to share a chunk of money to make local areas safer .
the money , from the comunity safety development fund , will be split between the county 's 14 districts and was agreed by the essex police and crime commissioner , roger hirst .
mr hirst said : `` neighbourhood watch do a great job in communities throughout essex .
`` working with the police they help provide intelligence to officers , support the elderly and vulnerable and go out of their way to make their local area safer . ''
neighbourhood watch has in excess of 100,000 members across essex , with at least 2500 groups across the 14 districts .
clive stewart , chairman of the essex county neighbourhood watch association said : `` our members come from all walks of life and provide a wide range of support .
`` this ongoing funding recognises the close working relationship between neighbourhood watch groups , local policing teams and the community . ''
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: billericay statue found discarded in wheelbarrow
text: a bronze statue that featured in a billericay park has been found three months after it was stolen from its plinth .
the child in the park - de a kneeling youngster holding a snail - was taken from lake meadows on valentine 's day , 14 february .
police say the statue was recovered in the ongar road area of brentwood on 5 may .
it was found in a wheelbarrow .
the friends of lake meadows had begun a fundraising campaign to pay for a replacement .
the group said on their website : `` there is quite a lot of work to do before we can take the child home .
`` it is not like replacing a vase on a shelf , but the good news is that there is no major damage to the outside of the statue and most of the work needed is within the shell . ''
they say the £ 2,100 raised will now go towards its restoration and reinstallment .
the statue , by sculptor john doubleday , was unveiled as part of a millennium project in 2001 .
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: general election 2017 : ukip activist 's anger over clacton candidate selection
text: a clacton councillor says he 's `` very angry '' at the decision by ukip to field a national candidate in the town 's seat for the general election .
jeff bray had previously defeated national executive committee member paul oakley in a vote by the local party .
in emails seen by bbc essex 's political reporter simon dedman , one local activist said the decision was `` shambolic '' .
clacton 's sitting mp , douglas carswell , had been ukip 's only mp until he quit the party - and later announced he would not stand for re-election .

former party donor arron banks , who had previously put himself forward to stand in the seat , tweeted : `` paul is a good chap , disappointing that the branch could n't select their own candidate - it 's the reason i did n't stand '' .
mr oakley will compete in the seat against liberal democrat david grace , labour 's natasha osben , independent caroline shearer , chris southall from the green party and conservative giles watling .
paul is a good chap , disappointing that the branch could n't select their own candidate - it 's the reason i did n't stand @ twitterid
another deposit gone , further alienation of the membership , when will elitist ukip learn ?
paul oakley ! !
arron , is paul a local essex man ?
like your endorsement of who is 'good ' carries any significance whatsoever .

documents.title: new stansted flight paths causing rise in noise complaints , campaigners claim
text: campaigners against the expansion of stansted airport say there 's been a big rise in noise complaints since new flight paths were introduced last year .
nearly a thousand complaints were made through stop stansted expansion in 2016 - compared to 16 the year before .
they say the worst affected areas are high easter , stebbing and felsted .
stansted made the changes in a bid to reduce the number of people `` overflown '' by aircraft .
the new flight paths are currently under review .
martin peachey , from stop stansted expansion , told bbc essex the old system was better on balance .
`` the small benefit the airlines will get is outweighed by the evidence of the number of complaints , '' he said .
stansted says it takes noise control seriously - and has encouraged people to have their say .
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

documents.title: attempted tesco raid : man arrested
text: a man has been arrested in connection with an attempted armed robbery at a supermarket in clacton .
the 30 year-old from dagenham was arrested on sus of robbery after two security guards were threatened outside tesco in the brook retail park on london road .
it happened back in january , when police said shots were fired but no-one was injured .
the man 's been released under investigation - and the inquiry continues .
author: Orla Moore
BBC Local Live

text: this is the scene that greeted police who raided a house in harlow after reports of an `` odour '' :
around 150 cannabis plants were removed from the house in pegrams road on monday afternoon .
officers were carrying out a drugs warrant after reports of a strong smell coming from the house .
they 're still looking for the people behind the cannabis factory .

documents.title: gypsy council calls for more tolerance towards travellers in brentwood
text: a gypsy council spokesman says people should have an `` open and fair mind about the traveller community '' .
it follows the news that three traveller sites have emerged around brentwood in recent days - two on private land and one just off the a127 .
phien o'reachtigan told bbc essex : `` they should not be prejudiced against them once they arrive in the area .
`` we 're talking about the public and how they perceive travellers .
what we should .
be talking about is the failure of all councils throughout the uk to provide permanent and temporary sites , '' he said .
one of the camps has signs up - warning people to stay away .
travellers have moved on to private land in wates way , off ongar road , and on the old toomey car showroom site off the a128 .
brentwood borough council said it was aware of the three incursions - and that the group occupying the private land had previously stayed in weald and warley country parks .
a spokesman said officers will `` continue to work with the police , the essex countywide traveller unit and other agencies to encourage appropriate and effective action '' .

he 's believed to have connections in .
the thurrock area .
if you know where he is - give the police a call .

documents.title: body found as police search for missing man is halted
text: officers say they have suspended the search for a missing man from southend after the discovery of a body .
robert jowers , 52 , was last seen on monday and concerns were raised for his welfare .
however , a body was found on farmland at barling , great wakering , at about 18:30 yesterday .
the death is not being treated as sus
the remains have n't been formally identified , but the search for mr jowers has been suspended .

they were found at an address on pegrams road on monday afternoon .
the team was acting on reports of a strong smell coming from the house - and suspected the production of drugs .
no arrests were made and police are still investigating .

documents.title: brentwood travellers move onto private site
text: a number of local residents unhappy about several traveller groups camping on land in the brentwood area have been told that it is up to the owners of the land to take action to remove them .
brentwood borough council says it 's aware of the issue and confirmed the travellers are the same group who recently occupied weald country park before moving to warley country park .
in a statement a spokesman for the borough council said : `` the travellers left warley country park after police issued notices ordering the group to move on by 12 noon today .
it added it was `` aware of two remaining traveller incursions , at wates way , and on the former toomey peugeot garage site on ingrave road .
`` both these sites are owned by private landlords who are responsible for any action , '' the council statement said .
a travellers group says such people are in a `` no win '' situation , and they are being unfairly targeted .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: ukip believe essex will deliver them an mp
text: the leader of ukip , paul nuttall , has told the bbc that his party has got a good chance of getting a new mp in the county in the general election .
ukip 's deputy leader peter whittle is standing for election in the south basildon & east thurrock constituency .
both men have been campaigning in basildon this afternoon .
mr nuttall believes it 's `` winnable '' .
`` essex is strong part of the country for ukip , '' he said .
`` i think we 've got a good chance of taking thurrock .
we 're only 800 votes behind last time .
it would take only a tiny swing for us to take that seat .
`` of course we are the opposition on the council there and we 're targetting it to make sure we can get over the line . ''
author: Simon Dedman
BBC Essex political reporter

documents.title: 'lucky to be alive ' says woman who had ear ripped by cows
text: an essex woman is warning fellow dog walkers to take care after she was trampled by a herd of cows as she walked along a footpath in a field in great yeldham near halstead .
carol green said she 's `` lucky to abe alive '' after being attacked by the cows who cornered her , kicking and head-butting her onto the ground before stamping on her neck .
she ended up with a torn ear .
despite being injured she managed to escape by climbing a gate .
`` by that time i was in a very traumatised state , blood coming down my face and i thought i was going to die . ''

ms green who suffered serious bruising believes the cows were being protective about their calves , but wants others to be mindful when walking in fields as the experience could have been a lot worse .
author: Jodie Halford
BBC News

documents.title: ukip leader visits basildon
text: the leader of ukip , paul nuttall , is out campaigning in basildon today .
it 's an area that historically has been strong for the party .
last week , ukip lost all its seats on essex county council in the local elections .
ukip 's deputy leader peter whittle is standing in the south basildon & east thurrock constituency in the general election .
author: Simon Dedman
BBC Essex political reporter

documents.title: man assaulted by teens
text: a man , in his forties , has been assaulted by a group of teenagers in basildon .
he was attacked , in butneys , yesterday evening at about 20:30 .
the victim was left with arm and facial injuries .
essex police say the suspects are described as white , asian and mixed race and aged about 15 and 16 years old .
suspects were believed to have made off in the direction of the gore , gloucester park and broadmayne .
author: Nick Alliker
BBC Essex

text: we 've had one of the driest aprils on record with under half the expected amount of rainfall for the month .
it follows one of the driest winters for 20 years bbc east weather forecaster dan holley 's tweet shows how it compares to average years .

documents.title: plea for missing teen
text: police say they 're concerned about a 14-year-old boy from colchester who has gone missing .
ermias yohannes was last seen on 3 may at about 17:00 and was wearing a red manchester united top , black trousers and black nike trainers .
officers say he has links to dagenham and ilford in east london .

BBC Essex

documents.title: two men injured after dog attack
text: two men have been injured after being bitten by a dog in clacton .
police say the attack happened over the weekend when they were called to reports of a 27-year-old man being attacked by a dog in plane view close on sunday afternoon .
another man intervened , but he was also bitten while attempting to restrain the animal .
both men were taken to hospital for treatment to their arms .
author: Nick Alliker
BBC Essex

documents.title: gorillaz : demon dayz festival line-up revealed
text: damon and the gang are off for a jolly boys ( and girls ) outing to the seaside and they 're bringing some of their finest musical friends with them .
de la soul , vince staples , fufanu and a yet-to-be-announced special guest will all appear before gorillaz on the main stage at their very own demon dayz festival in margate , kent on 10 june .
check out the rest of the lineup on a rather cool-looking animated video above .

documents.title: passengers miss flights at stansted after security delays
text: one passenger caught up in the chaos at stansted says she 's managed to get on another flight , but some others she spoke to would now have to wait until thursday .
kate-elizabeth told me she had managed to secure a place on the 17:00 flight to rhodes for a short sunshine break , but others were n't so lucky as ryanair only fly to the island a few times a week .
the problem with the x-ray machines emerged at about 04:30 and was resolved by 08:15 , a spokeswoman for the airport said .
`` due to a technical issue earlier this morning with a number of x-ray machines in the main security area , throughput capacity was reduced , taking extra time to process passengers .
`` engineers rectified the issue and additional measures were put in place to minimise the impact to passengers and assist them with their onward journey .
`` we apologise for the inconvenience caused . ''
stansted is the fourth busiest airport in the uk and is used by an average of 67,000 passengers each day .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: chaos at stansted after scanners breakdown
text: stansted airport has apologised after a fault with security scanners caused long queues at the north essex terminal earlier today .
some passengers have missed their flights .
the problem with the x-ray machines lasted for about four hours .
passengers posted photographs of large crowds inside the terminal building on social media .
one traveller , posting on twitter with the username kate-elizabeth , wrote : `` all the scanners went down at stansted airport .
`` there was a huge pile up , staff did n't prioritise the times of anyone 's flights and ryanair did n't hold the flight for all those delayed .
`` it was still on the tarmac when we all eventually got to the gate only to be told we could n't board . ''
she added she was `` quite honestly doing my best not to cry this morning '' .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC News

documents.title: moped theft victim dragged along street
text: a woman from rainham says she 's struggling to get over an attack by two men on a moped which left her badly hurt .
it happened last year in broad daylight .
the men shouted abuse at pagan-lilley motlagh-philips and her brother before driving over her .
ms motlagh-philips says what happened to her was shocking : `` i had really bad internal bruising and i could n't walk for a few weeks after the handle bars and hit my stomach .
i could n't stand up or lift myself up .
`` i 've had physical scarring and unfortunately that scarring still has n't healed . ''
essex police is warning people to be more aware of their surroundings when using smart devices after a rise in robberies being committed by opportunist criminals on scooters .
ch insp lewis basford says people will `` know who these individuals are , who are part of gangs who go around doing this '' and he 's asking the public to report them .

text: man cleared of music festival assault

documents.title: 'good water supplies ' in the east despite drought fears
text: anglian water says water levels in the east of england are `` good '' and there will be no need for a hosepipe ban come summer , despite the recent record dry weather .
october to march has been the driest in the uk for more than 20 years and there 's been a particular lack of rain in southern and eastern counties of england .
emma staples from the company said `` there will not be any restrictions '' on usage this year .
`` our reservoirs are on average 94 % full .
that 's absolutely ample for this time of year , '' she said .
despite dry weather we have good water supplies in the east , there will be no hosepipe ban this summer .
read more
what about your aquifers though as you supply most of water out of the ground ?
yes , half our water comes from aquifers .
we are keeping a close eye on them but nothing to worry about at the moment
what about the river great ouse ? ?
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: criminals using mopeds to steal
text: crimes involving gangs on mopeds are on the rise according to essex police and offenders usually steal the bikes to commit other offences .
recently , police have investigated a string of robberies by thieves using mopeds in the brentwood area .
in another case in leigh-on-sea , a woman was dragged along the pavement by moped riders who grabbed her handbag and left her with serious injuries .
in london , it 's estimated there are 31 incidents involving scooters every day .
people are being warned to be careful about having mobile phones on show and bags easily reachable .
author: Sonia Watson
BBC Essex

documents.title: creating a new council is 'not about staff cuts '
text: the leaders of st edmundsbury borough , and forest heath district councils are reassuring staff the move to merge and create a new joint authority should n't affect them .

james waters ( right ) , conservative leader of forest heath , said : `` this is not about staff cuts this is making us more robust , more fit for purpose , more strength to deliver quality services .
`` if the staff are concerned this morning , just get in , do your job the way you 're doing it and it should be fine . ''

leader of st edmundsbury , john griffiths , conservative , added : `` actually it 's thanks to their hard work that we 're in a position to do this and i hope the staff will look forward to this making their jobs more satisfying and easier . ''
plans published today suggest the two councils , who 've shared a chief executive for several years , and have merged back-room staff , will come together to create a brand new council by 2019 .
both councils already have a shared website as well , called west suffolk - working together .
author: Kelly McCormack
BBC Radio Suffolk

documents.title: cup winner izzet leaves needham market 'in a better place '
text: former colchester united midfielder kem izzet was back at the western homes community stadium last night in needham market colours .
the 36-year-old helped the markemen to a 3-2 victory over lowestoft town in the final of the suffolk premier cup in what was his final appearance for mark morsley 's side .
`` it 's been a good four years and i 've enjoyed every bit of it , '' izzet told us at full time .
`` while it 's not all about me , i 've left the club in a better place and i 'm happy with the job i 've done .
it 's a great time to leave . ''
izzet will now take up a player-manager role at another club , the identity of which is expected to be revealed later this week .
author: Graeme Mac
BBC Radio Suffolk sport

documents.title: legend of the essex serpent
text: the mythical essex serpent story is one of many older tales which have inspired literature

documents.title: author wins top prize at book awards
text: an author who based a novel on essex folklore has won book of the year at the british book awards .
sarah perry , who is based in norwich , was inspired by a saffron walden legend and her book , the essex serpent , is a gothic tale set in the 1890s .

cathy rentzenbrink , chair of the judges , said : `` the essex serpent is a joyous and beguiling novel that made me wish i was a bookseller again so i could press it into the hands of all my customers .
`` the essex serpent is a perfect winner of this prize - a stunning book published with both skill and love that engaged the entire industry . ''
it also won the fiction book of the year award at a ceremony held last night .

documents.title: tuesday 's weather : another grey day , but a tad warmer
text: another cloudy day but it 's not going to feel so cold across the bbc east region .
the keen north/north-easterly breeze has fallen light overnight but you 're still going to feel it along the north norfolk coast .
elsewhere there 'll be a slightly more mild feel to the day , with highs of about 13c ( 55f ) inland .

documents.title: braintree manager 'came so close ' to saving side from relegation
text: as you may have seen on this page earlier , braintree town have parted company with their manager hakan hayrettin ( below ) .
he 'd replaced jamie day in september , when they were in the relegation zone after just two wins from their opening 12 games .
despite winning 15 of his 41 matches in charge , braintree were relegated by a final-day defeat at aldershot .
chairman lee harding said : `` if we had appointed hakan back in the summer and given him that blank sheet of paper , i am sure we would not have struggled as we have .
`` he 's given us everything and came so close the securing our status . ''

documents.title: severly disabled girl given £ 5.1m nhs compensation payout
text: a young girl who was born with severe disabilities has won more than £ 5m from southend hospital in compensation .
the 10-year-old , who can not be identified , has `` devastating intellectual and physical problems '' and will always need round-the-clock care , the high court heard .
southend university hospitals nhs trust had denied blame for her injuries but , after difficult negotiations , agreed to pay 50 % of the full value of her claim .
she will receive a £ 5.1m lump sum to cover care costs for the rest of her life .

approving the compromise , judge richard pearce remarked : `` money will go some way to improving the claimant 's quality of life , but what will always be more important is the love and support she receives from her family . ''

documents.title: further arrests made over teenager stab attack
text: three people have been arrested over the stabbing of a teenage boy in chelmsford last month .
the victim was taken to hospital after the attack in wallasea gardens ( below ) - he was stabbed in the back and was left with serious injuries , but has since been discharged from hospital .
essex police said two 17-year-old boys and an 18-year-old man , all from the chelmsford area , were arrested on sus of grievous bodily harm on sunday , and have been released under investigation .
a 15-year-old boy from chelmsford , arrested over the same offence , has also been released under investigation .
police continue to appeal for witnesses to the attack at 18:45 on 30 april .

the teenager was crossing oxford road near travis perkins yesterday afternoon when the crash happened .
the car involved was reported to have briefly stopped , and a man spoke to the girl , who had minor injuries , before getting back into the vehicle and driving off .
he 's described as white , with grey hair and was thought to be in his 40s .
police want to hear from anyone who saw what happened .

documents.title: child sex abuse : 'we can not arrest our way out of it '
text: simon bailey , norfolk 's chief constable and the national police chiefs ' council 's lead for child protection , says the police service alone can not deal with the problem of child sex abuse on the internet .

he said : `` the police service across the uk is arresting over 400 men every month , we 're safeguarding over 500 children every month , but it can not simply be an exercise in arrest , arrest , arrest whilst we 're doing more than any other country in the world within this field , we simply can not arrest our way out of it . ''
mr bailey says they have to look at the root cause of the exploitation , and he believes tech companies hold the key .
the root cause is people are taking these images and sharing them because they feel they can do it within an environment which they believe is fairly anonymous .
we 're demonstrating through the number of arrests we are making that it is not . ''

documents.title: braintree part with boss hayrettin

documents.title: child sex abuse : the 'dark side of the web '
text: the chief constable of norfolk , simon bailey , says it 's the internet companies that hold the key to stopping people from viewing images of child sexual abuse online .
it comes as six police forces across our region team up with the charity the lucy faithfull foundation to encourage offenders to get help .

mr bailey , who 's the national police chiefs ' council 's lead officer on child protection , says he believes the internet has opened up a whole series of opportunities for men who 've always had a sexual interest in children to now fulfill their perverted obsessions .

`` it is now terribly unfortunate that that facility now exists and i would be very public in saying the web is a force for good , but there is a dark side to it and unfortunately one of the elements of that dark side is the abuse of children and the proliferation of indecent imagery . ''

that 's why it is so important that we take this multi-faceted approach and simply do n't rely on the technical companies to try and eradicate it , do n't rely solely on the police arresting these people - there 's got to be an element of self-help , which is why the netsafe campaign and the work of lucy faithfull is so important . ''
the police forces which are working together are bedfordshire , cambridgeshire , essex , hertfordshire , norfolk and suffolk .

documents.title: have you spotted britain 's largest bird of prey ?
text: more on that white-tailed eagle
as we 've been reporting , the huge bird , which is also known as the sea eagle , was spotted at buckenham marshes at cantley , norfolk , on wednesday and thursday .
the rspb said it has now flown to essex .
we 'd like to hear from you if you 've spotted it :
let us know if you 've seen it , by clicking `` get involved '' above .
plans to re-introduce the bird to east anglia with an official programme failed to get off the ground in 2010 .
author: Kate Scotter
BBC News

documents.title: britain 's largest bird of prey spotted in east anglia
text: sightings of a white-tailed eagle have caused a ripple of excitement across east anglia .
britain 's largest bird of prey was most recently spotted at buckenham marshes at cantley , norfolk .
the rspb said it is now thought to be in essex .
often described as a `` flying barn door '' due to the size of its broad wings , the bird stands almost a metre ( 3.3ft ) tall .
an rspb spokeswoman said people had been visiting the reserve at strumpshaw fen with the aim of spotting the bird .
she said : `` the bird has been wandering around east anglia for the last month and has probably flown over from the near continent .
`` it 's likely that it 's an immature bird looking for a nesting site and that it will probably head back over the north sea soon . ''
author: Kate Scotter
BBC News

documents.title: former essex mp in court on electoral fraud charges
text: a former conservative mp who defected to ukip will have his electoral fraud case heard at crown court .
the charges against bob spink relate to the local election campaign for castle point borough council in 2016 .
he is accused of five counts of submitting false signatures on nomination papers on or before 5 april 2016 .
mr spink appeared this morning before magistrates in southend .

both mr spink and ukip activist james parkin , who faces nine counts of of submitting false signatures on nomination papers on or before 5 april 2016 , have had their cases transferred to basildon crown court for a hearing on 5 june .

documents.title: police launch bid to tackle child abuse
text: six police forces across the east of england are launching a new campaign aimed at tackling online viewing of child sexual abuse images .
operation netsafe is a joint venture between the police and child protection charity , the lucy faithfull foundation .
in february , bbc research found the number of suspected online child sex offenders identified in the east had nearly trebled in three years .

the operation will try to deter potential offenders in norfolk , suffolk , cambridgeshire , essex , bedfordshire and hertfordshire , by raising awareness of the severe consequences for those who view such images .
it also aims to hammer home that these victims are real children who are being abused .
simon bailey , national police chiefs ' council lead for child protection , said forces were dealing with `` an unprecedented volume of child sexual abuse reports '' .
`` child sexual abuse is a crime and so is possessing images of that abuse .
`` often offenders convince themselves that as the images already exist there is n't a victim as they do n't have direct contact with the children or young people involved .
but these children were abused and exploited to make these images . ''
in just one year more than 1,800 people across eastern england sought help to stop looking at child abuse images via the lucy faithfull foundation 's `` stop it now ! ''
helpline , the charity said .
author: Adam Jinkerson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: colchester united miss out on play-off spot
text: in case you missed it over the weekend , colchester united faced crunch time in their game against yeovil .
despite winning 2-0 , the u 's missed out on a spot in the league two promotion play-offs by a single point after rivals carlisle united came from behind to win 3-2 at exeter city .
colchester united head coach john mcgreal ( with his manager of the month award for december ) said he could n't have asked any more from his players .
`` there 's a load of bright points for this football club , and we 're going to continue to move forward , '' he said .

documents.title: concern grows for missing nigel kedar
text: it 's five weeks on from the disappearance of a man from clacton and detectives in norfolk - where he was last seen on or near the a140 - have said they 're growing `` increasingly concerned '' for his welfare .
nigel kedar , 52 , was last spotted at 09:30 on 4 april walking southbound through dickleburgh in south norfolk towards suffolk , but there have n't been any sightings of him since .
norfolk police said their inquiries had revealed he visited norwich on 2 april and afterwards made his way on foot through long stratton , pulham market and dickleburgh .
his family have said it 's completely out of character as he 'd made plans to spend time with his teenage son over easter .
det ch insp marie james said : `` i would urge anyone who was travelling in the dickleburgh , scole or diss areas to contact us as you may have vital information which will help us find nigel . ''
he is described as being white , 5ft 11in tall , of a large build with short hair .
he was wearing dark trousers with a lighter coloured long sleeved shirt .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: bgt 's harry gardener praised by alzheimer charity
text: if you watched britain 's got talent at the weekend you will have seen a chelmsford teenager getting a standing ovation for his singing performance .
harry gardner , 16 , sang not alone , a song he wrote about his nan maureen mcguinness who had dementia .
she died from the disease in april , shortly after his audition .
the teenager has now been been praised by alzheimer 's research uk for the work he 's done to raise awareness of the condition .
last year , the song went viral for the charity and helped raise £ 8,000 .
following his audition , judge simon cowell said he would remember it because it was `` very genuine '' and `` absolutely showed your talent as a song writer '' .
harry , who is currently taking his as levels , said of the audition : `` the whole experience was a bit of a blur , but the feeling after i 'd done it was absolutely incredible .
`` i wrote the song from the bottom of my heart .
my nan meant so much to me and it devastated me to see her that way . ''
last year harry was made a champion of alzheimer 's research uk , an accolade given to those who have gone `` above and beyond '' to raise funds and awareness for the charity .
the charity 's director , tim parry , said they were `` thrilled '' to see him on britain 's got talent .
`` harry is an inspiration to young people and we 've been blown away by his commitment to support the charity in honour of his nan , '' he said .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

text: an investigation is under way following a lorry fire in rayleigh at the weekend .

the vehicle was full of builder 's waste and crews spent much of sunday tackling it , closing the road for several hours , and finally leaving the scene at 16:00 .

documents.title: the fleet through to play-off final
text: ebbsfleet united are through to their third play-off final in four seasons after a 2-1 home win against hampton and richmond .
it gave them a 4-2 aggregate victory in the national league south semi-finals .
defender kenny clark got the first fleet goal on 36 minutes , hampton equalised on the hour to make it a nervy second half until sub darren mcqueen scored a minute from time .
but it wo n't be an all-kent final - dartford were beaten 2-1 at home by chelmsford city after a goalless first leg .
duane ofori-acheampong got the darts goal in injury time .
ebbsfleet host chelmsford on saturday for a place in the national league .
author: Matt Cole
Sports Editor, BBC Radio Kent
